alert.note: Alert for Iron (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 10:05PM CDT until May 16 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Iron and Reynolds. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen across western Reynolds County in the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are expected over eastern Reynolds and southern Iron counties. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ironton, Reynolds, Ellington, Arcadia, Annapolis, Glover, Oates, Garwood, Centerville, Des Arc, Redford, Lesterville, Black, Corridon, Sabula, Chloride, Hogan and Vulcan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
